prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: 110 GHz -13CO
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: Mosaic to map the 13CO(1-0), C18O(1-0) and CS(2-1) emission over a significant part of M74's optical disk to match ALMA Cycle 1 12CO(2-1) imaging. As a ToO we target HNCO at 109.906 GHz, CH3CN at 110.34 GHz HC3N at 109.023 GHz, and SO2 at 109.252 GHz, in addition to CH3OH at 96.741 GHz in the lower sideband as well as potential continuum emission from embedded star forming regions.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText:
This proposal targets GMCs with masses above 1e5 M_sun which should constitute at least half of all GMCs detected in our Cycle 1 CO(2-1) observations. Based on our results for M51 typical peak brightnesses, line widths and sizes of such GMCs are 2K, 15km/s and 70pc (Colombo et al. 2013). Therefore the required angular resolution is 70pc (i.e. 2.0"). The size of the field-of-view (FoV) is driven bycour aim to probe the (dense) molecular gas associated with (or relatedcto) star formation in different galactic environments. In particular, the proposed area will cover all 24 studied star forming regions (Gusev et al. 2013) that showed distinct differences in their properties between the two spiral arms while maintaining the ability to probe potential radial variations (as, e.g., seen in M33, Gratier et al. 2012).
Imaging -- In order to map the same area (as is currently observed in CO(2-1) in Cycle 1), we require 53 pointings at 110/115GHz and 39 pointings at 90GHz using the default pointing separation. We request short spacing information from ACA+TP for all sets at 115 and 110GHz as we expect to be sensitive to a global diffuse component that is common in nearby spiral galaxies (e.g. Pety et al. 2013, Caldu Primo et al. 2013). The 90GHz setting contains only molecular lines that arise from dense gas. Therefore, we do not expect emission from scales larger than 15'' (i.e. 0.5kpc).
Sensitivity -- The required rms to detect GMCs down to 1e5M_sun at 5sigma in a single 5km/s channel is then 0.4 K for 12CO(1-0). Assuming typical brightness ratios of 1/10 and 1/15 for 13CO(1-0) and HCN(1-0) translates into 0.04K and 0.027K. As we do not require spectral information for the dense gas tracers at 90GHz, we plan to smooth over 3 channels, i.e. a velocity width of 15 km/s, therefore the requested rms is 0.046K (per 15\,km/s channel).
Correlator set-up -- We optimize the correlator set-up to include all our target lines with a typical resolution (channel width) of about 5 km/s. In addition, we utilize the FDM 1875 MHz setting in such a way to allow for serendipitous detection of other faint molecules and to obtain additional continuum information on the free-free emission arising from massive star forming regions. Therefore we request to not retain the spectral resolution.
Standard calibration and bandpass accuracy are sufficient for this project. Numbers are summarized in the table.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: 90 GHz - HCN, HNC, HCO+
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: Mosaic to map the emission from dense gas tracers (HCN< HNC, HCO+) over a significant part of M74's optical disk to match ALMA Cycle 1 12CO(2-1) imaging. As a ToO we target HC3N at 90.979 GHz and 100.076 GHz as well as potential continuum emission from embedded star forming regions.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: 115 GHz - 12CO
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: Mosaic to map the 12CO(1-0) emission over a significant part of M74's optical disk to match ALMA Cycle 1 12CO(2-1) imaging. As a ToO we target the CN line at 113.491 GHz in the same sideband and the H recombination line at 103.915 GHz in the lower sideband as well as potential continuum emission from embedded star forming regions.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText:
This proposal targets GMCs with masses above 1e5 M_sun which should constitute at least half of all GMCs detected in our Cycle 1 CO(2-1) observations. prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract: In order to formulate a general star formation theory, the underlying physics that govern star formation processes within galaxies must be understood. Our recent results on extragalactic Giant Molecular Cloud (GMC) populations imply that the internal structure and organization of molecular gas strongly depends on galactic environment - as does their star formation efficiency (SFE), though with different dependencies. Recent studies suggest that the SFE is set by the dense gas fraction and not the global molecular reservoir. Thus, we propose to map the dense gas fraction of massive GMCs (at 70pc(=2") resolution) in the nearby spiral galaxy M74 with ALMA. The dense gas fraction will be determined using several 3mm tracers (low to high density: 12CO, CS, HCO+, 13CO, C18O, HCN, HNC). These tracers will additionally probe the excitation conditions (HCO+, HNC, HCN, 12CO) and independently estimate the CO-to-H2 conversion factor (via the (1-0) transitions of 12CO, 13CO, C18O plus 12CO(2-1)). The requested observations will cover the same area as already mapped in CO(2-1) by our Cycle 1 program that will characterize the general GMC population and the different galactic environments.
prp:ObsProposal.prp:previousProposals: 2012.1.00650.S The Role of Galactic Environment in GMC and Star Formation (E. Schinnerer)
